pullRequest.body:
This PR moves the lemma `card_fiber_eq_of_mem_range` from `RingTheory/IntegralDomain` to `GroupTheory/Index` which makes far more sense. It also adds the additive version, generalizes to `MonoidHomClass`, and puts it in the `MonoidHom` namespace (instead of root).

Co-authored-by: Yury Kudryashov <urkud@urkud.name>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary

#### Import changes

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

```
</details>

Is the PR description accurate? It says "this PR *moves*..." but I only see a new declaration. Anyway LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: dupuisf can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Is the PR description accurate? It says "this PR _moves_..." but I only see a new declaration. Anyway LGTM, thanks!
> 

Indeed I messed up when merging master somehow. Now it's an actual move again. Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9450586568/job/26029534147)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9450586568/job/26029533792)
It seems like you may have forgotten the deprecated alias?

You don't need the codomain to be a group. I have this code somewhere in the history of leanprover-community/mathlib#17653 (lost to a buggy merge):
```lean
@[to_additive] lemma monoid_hom.card_fiber_eq_of_mem_range {M} [monoid M] [decidable_eq M]
  (f : G ‚Üí* M) {x y : M} (hx : x ‚àà set.range f) (hy : y ‚àà set.range f) :
  (univ.filter $ Œª g, f g = x).card = (univ.filter $ Œª g, f g = y).card :=
begin
  rcases ‚ü®hx, hy‚ü© with ‚ü®‚ü®x, rfl‚ü©, y, rfl‚ü©,
  rcases mul_left_surjective x y with ‚ü®y, rfl‚ü©,
  conv_lhs { rw [‚Üê map_univ_equiv (equiv.mul_right y‚Åª¬π), filter_map, card_map] },
  congr' 2 with g,
  simp only [(‚àò), equiv.to_embedding_apply, equiv.coe_mul_right, map_mul],
  rw [‚Üê f.coe_to_hom_units y‚Åª¬π, map_inv, units.mul_inv_eq_iff_eq_mul, f.coe_to_hom_units]
```
Not sure if it depends on other modifications I made in that branch. I should've ported it to Lean 4 long ago.

UPD: have a look at [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/17653/files#diff-7f1be6b9022b8228482801f42e5005df11252d1a068c3c1c8da0ee85078cc538R2014) section of that PR (`preimage`/`image` lemmas are better fomulated using pointwise smul).
I just ported the above proof to Lean 4. It didn't depend on anything else in that old Lean 3 PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: move and generalize card_fiber_eq_of_mem_range
